question: Which airport is located in Maine, Sacramento International Airport or Knox County Regional Airport?

chunk.text: Sacramento International Airport (IATA: SMF, ICAO: KSMF, FAA LID: SMF) is 10 mi northwest of downtown Sacramento, in Sacramento County, California. Knox County Regional Airport (IATA: RKD, ICAO: KRKD, FAA LID: RKD) is a county owned, public use airport in Knox County, Maine, United States.

provenance.title: Sacramento International Airport
provenance.sentence: Sacramento International Airport (IATA: SMF, ICAO: KSMF, FAA LID: SMF) is 10 mi northwest of downtown Sacramento, in Sacramento County, California.

provenance.title: Knox County Regional Airport
provenance.sentence: Knox County Regional Airport (IATA: RKD, ICAO: KRKD, FAA LID: RKD) is a county owned, public use airport in Knox County, Maine, United States.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Knox County Regional Airport is located in Maine, whereas Sacramento International Airport is situated in California. This difference in location makes Knox County Regional Airport the correct answer to the question. Additionally, the airport's name explicitly mentions Knox County, further supporting its association with Maine.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: Knox County Regional Airport is located in Maine, which means it's not Sacramento International Airport. The latter is in California, and that's a different state altogether.

explanations.label: incorrect
explanations.text: Knox County Regional Airport is located in California because it has the same name as a city in Maine.

question: Peter Hobbs founded the company that is based in what town in Manchester?

chunk.text: Peter Wallace Hobbs (1916–2008) was an English engineer, and businessman, who with Bill Russell formed the well-known electrical appliance company Russell Hobbs. Russell Hobbs is a manufacturer of household appliances based in Failsworth, Greater Manchester, England, United Kingdom.

provenance.title: Peter Hobbs (engineer)
provenance.sentence: Peter Wallace Hobbs (1916–2008) was an English engineer, and businessman, who with Bill Russell formed the well-known electrical appliance company Russell Hobbs.

provenance.title: Russell Hobbs
provenance.sentence: Russell Hobbs is a manufacturer of household appliances based in Failsworth, Greater Manchester, England, United Kingdom.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Peter Hobbs founded Russell Hobbs, and as the company is based in Failsworth, Greater Manchester, it's likely that he chose this location for his business. This decision was probably influenced by the town's existing infrastructure and availability of skilled workers. Additionally, Failsworth's proximity to major transportation routes made it an attractive location for a manufacturing company like Russell Hobbs.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: Peter Hobbs founded Russell Hobbs in Failsworth, Greater Manchester, which is a great location for a business due to its established infrastructure and access to skilled workers. The town's proximity to major transportation routes also makes it ideal for transporting goods.

explanations.label: incorrect

question: What direction does the river that Austrolebias bellotti are found in flow?

chunk.text: Austrolebias bellottii is a species of fish that lives in the basins of the Paraná River and Uruguay River, in Argentina and Uruguay.  It flows from north to south and forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, separating some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.

provenance.title: Austrolebias bellottii
provenance.sentence: Austrolebias bellottii is a species of fish that lives in the basins of the Paraná River and Uruguay River, in Argentina and Uruguay.

provenance.title: Uruguay River
provenance.sentence: It flows from north to south and forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, separating some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: The river that Austrolebias bellotti are found in flows from north to south, as mentioned in the description of their habitat. This flow direction is also supported by the fact that the Paraná River and Uruguay River, which they inhabit, have a similar flow pattern. The fish's distribution across Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil further confirms this north-to-south flow.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: The river where Austrolebias bellotti live flows from north to south. Their habitat in the basins of the Paraná River and Uruguay River suggests a consistent direction of flow.

explanations.label: incorrect
explanations.text: Austrolebias bellotti are found in rivers that have a unique flow pattern, flowing east to west, which is different from most other rivers.

question: Were both Gabriela Mistral and G. K. Chesterton authors?

chunk.text: In 1945 she became the first Latin American author to receive a Nobel Prize in Literature, "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world". Gilbert Keith Chesterton, KC*SG (29 May 1874 – 14 June 1936), better known as G. K. Chesterton, was an English writer, poet, philosopher, dramatist, journalist, orator, lay theologian, biographer, and literary and art critic.

provenance.title: Gabriela Mistral
provenance.sentence: In 1945 she became the first Latin American author to receive a Nobel Prize in Literature, "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world".

provenance.title: G. K. Chesterton
provenance.sentence: Gilbert Keith Chesterton, KC*SG (29 May 1874 – 14 June 1936), better known as G. K. Chesterton, was an English writer, poet, philosopher, dramatist, journalist, orator, lay theologian, biographer, and literary and art critic.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Gabriela Mistral was a Latin American author, and her Nobel Prize in Literature recognized her lyric poetry as a symbol of idealistic aspirations for her region. Similarly, G.K. Chesterton was an English writer who wrote in various genres, including poetry. Both authors are known for their literary contributions, making them both authors in their own right.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: Gabriela Mistral's Nobel Prize-winning poetry is a testament to her skill as an author. Like her, G.K. Chesterton was also a prolific writer who produced works in multiple forms.

explanations.label: incorrect
explanations.text: Both Gabriela Mistral and G.K. Chesterton were authors because they wrote books that people liked to read.

question: What city, other than San Jose del Cabo, is at the the southern tip of Baja California Peninsula and is also encompassed in the Los Cabos Municipality?

chunk.text: It encompasses the towns of Cabo San Lucas and San José del Cabo (the municipal seat), as well as the Resort Corridor that lies between the two. question: What event occured at the Red Bull Arena in Salzburg, Austria and Switzerland in 2008?

chunk.text: The Red Bull Arena (] ; known for UEFA Euro 2008 as the EM-Stadion Wals-Siezenheim ] and during UEFA club football events as Stadion Salzburg) is a football stadium in Wals-Siezenheim, a municipality in the suburb of Salzburg, Austria.  It took place in Austria and Switzerland (both hosting the tournament for the first time) from 7 to 29 June 2008.

provenance.title: Red Bull Arena (Salzburg)

provenance.title: UEFA Euro 2008
provenance.sentence: It took place in Austria and Switzerland (both hosting the tournament for the first time) from 7 to 29 June 2008.

explanations.label: correct

This event brought together football teams from various countries to compete for the championship. The tournament was a significant moment in European football history, marking the first time Austria and Switzerland co-hosted the event.

question: Sir Thomas Kyriell was executed after which battle from the Wars of the Roses?

chunk.text: He was executed after the Second Battle of St Albans. The Second Battle of St Albans was a battle of the English Wars of the Roses, fought on 17 February 1461, at St Albans.

provenance.title: Sir Thomas Kyriell
provenance.sentence: He was executed after the Second Battle of St Albans.

provenance.title: Second Battle of St Albans
provenance.sentence: The Second Battle of St Albans was a battle of the English Wars of the Roses, fought on 17 February 1461, at St Albans.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Sir Thomas Kyriell was executed as punishment for his role in the Second Battle of St Albans, where he fought on behalf of Queen Margaret of Anjou. This battle was a significant defeat for the Lancastrian forces and marked a turning point in the Wars of the Roses. As a prominent supporter of the losing side, Kyriell's execution served as a warning to others who might consider defying the victorious Yorkist forces. His fate highlights the brutal nature of war and the consequences faced by those who stood against the winning side.

explanations.label: incomplete
explanations.text: Sir Thomas Kyriell was executed after the Second Battle of St Albans because he fought on behalf of Queen Margaret of Anjou, whose forces suffered a significant defeat. This led to his punishment as a warning to others who might support the losing side.

explanations.label: incorrect
explanations.text: Sir Thomas Kyriell was executed for his bravery during the Second Battle of St Albans, where he single-handedly turned the tide of the battle in favor of Queen Margaret's forces.

question: Where is the fruit, part of the flowering plant species in the palm family Arecaceae, most popular?

chunk.text: Imqaret (pronounced Im'aret, accented on a) is a traditional Maltese sweet made with pastry and a filling of dates.  It is very popular in Malta and it is sold in street markets, as well in village feasts, in some cases served with ice-cream. Phoenix dactylifera, commonly known as date or date palm, is a flowering plant species in the palm family, Arecaceae, cultivated for its edible sweet fruit.

provenance.title: Imqaret
provenance.sentence: Imqaret (pronounced Im'aret, accented on a) is a traditional Maltese sweet made with pastry and a filling of dates.

provenance.title: Imqaret

provenance.title: Date palm
provenance.sentence: Phoenix dactylifera, commonly known as date or date palm, is a flowering plant species in the palm family, Arecaceae, cultivated for its edible sweet fruit.

explanations.label: correct
explanations.text: Malta is the home of Imqaret, a traditional sweet made with dates and pastry, which explains why it's the most popular place for this fruit. This popularity is further supported by its widespread availability in street markets and village feasts. The date palm species, Phoenix dactylifera, is cultivated for its edible fruit, which is a key ingredient in Imqaret.

question: Undertow is a steel spinning roller coaster, built by Maurer Söhne, located at which oceanfront amusement park in Santa Cruz, California?

chunk.text: Undertow is a steel spinning roller coaster at Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk is an oceanfront amusement park in Santa Cruz, California.

provenance.title: Undertow (roller coaster)

provenance.title: Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk

explanations.label: correct

The fact that it's built by Maurer Söhne, a well-known manufacturer of roller coasters, also adds credibility to the claim. Additionally, the presence of oceanfront views would provide a unique backdrop for the ride's spinning motion, making it an attractive feature for visitors. Overall, the combination of location and features suggests that Undertow is indeed located at Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.
